title: Protecting Public Health and the Environment and Restoring Science To Tackle the Climate Crisis

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to review and reverse policies from the past four years that conflict with efforts to tackle climate change and protect the environment. It prioritizes restoring science-based decision-making, addressing environmental justice, protecting public health, reviewing national monument boundaries, and revoking the Keystone XL pipeline permit to promote clean energy and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
potential_concerns: Rolling back previous regulations rapidly may create uncertainty for industries and legal challenges.
Reinstating national monument boundaries could face opposition from local stakeholders and states affected by land-use changes.
The moratorium on Arctic oil and gas leasing could impact energy jobs and regional economies reliant on fossil fuel activities.
Measuring and applying social costs of greenhouse gases may be technically complex and contested politically.
Suspending or revoking infrastructure-related executive orders might delay certain development projects and complicate interagency coordination.
